Waiting for your explanation how I can fill in missing javadoc and to
write=
 automatic tests.

See my answers below quoted text.

--- In junit@yahoogro=
ups.com, "Kent Beck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>...our
> philosophy has always bee=
n to make JUnit an intersection instead of
a union
> of all useful testing-=
related functionality.

Ok, I see. You don't want to add new feature unless=
 it will be useful
to everybody. You don't want to overload the core.
  
> =
The next steps I would suggest for you are:
>     1) Do something to accele=
rate the 4.5 release, like fill in missing
> javadoc.
>     2) Add automate=
d tests to your feature requests.

How can I add automated tests or add jav=
adoc if I don't have write
rights to CVS? It will be pleasure for me to hel=
p you. I just want to
know how can I technically do it.

  
> Beginning to =
contribute to an existing project is a little like going to
> someone else'=
s home. If you are demanding, if you rearrange all the
> furniture, if, in =
short, you act like you are the most important
person in
> the room, then y=
ou are unlikely to be welcome. If you listen
carefully and
> offer to help,=
 you have a chance of building a relationship that
will help
> you feel at =
home and prepare the way for a closer relationship.

I understand your poin=
t. You see, I don't want to change your design,
rewrite your code or to add=
 significant amount of new features. I want
only to add enhancements / impr=
ovements to existing one. In other
words, I don't want to rearrange the fur=
niture I want to add some
decorative elements to your room.
